Legal_Issue: Whether the adjudicator had jurisdiction to hear the complaints under s. 242(3.1)(a) of the Canada Labour Code
Legal_Rule: Under s. 242(3.1)(a) of the Canada Labour Code, no complaint shall be considered by an adjudicator if the person was laid off due to lack of work or discontinuance of a function, provided the employer acted in good faith
Grounds_for_Claim: Layoff due to financial constraints and reorganization
Outcome_on_Merits: Case dismissed due to lack of jurisdiction
Legal_Framework: Canada Labour Code, Part III – Protection of Employees
Legal_Rule_Source: s. 242(3.1)(a) of the Canada Labour Code
Defendant_Response: Employer acted in good faith in discontinuing functions
Outcome: Adjudicator lacked jurisdiction; complaint not admissible
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Layoff due to discontinuance of function and lack of work
Applicable_Process: Complaint process under Canada Labour Code, judicial review
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under Canada Labour Code
Governing_Rule: s. 242(3.1)(a) of the Canada Labour Code
